medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr G underwent a bilateral nerve-sparing radical prostatectomy about 1 year ago, after which he lost natural erectile function for approximately 9 months. By 6 months post-surgery, there was no notable improvement in erectile function. He eventually began penile injection therapy, which worked for him, and he achieved an erection on his own after 9 months and 16 days post-surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Adenocarcinoma of the prostate diagnosed with a Gleason score of 6; underwent surgery for localized prostate cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Mr G is a previously healthy 51-year-old health program administrator. He has never used cigarettes, and he takes nutritional supplements including saw palmetto, fish oil, and various vitamins.
